numbered_ace_sentences: 1. There are two Basketball Associations.
2. Both Basketball Associations have high percentages of people of color.
3. This means that people of color have a better chance to play basketball.
4. This means that people of color have a better chance to coach basketball.
5. The NFL has a high percentage of players of color.
6. The NFL has a lower percentage of coaches of color than the percentage of players of color in the NFL.
7. The MLS has 60% players of color.
8. The MLS has the highest percentage of head coaches of color.
9. The MLS has 40% head coaches of color.
10. The MLB has less than 50% players of color.
11. The MLB does not keep its players as diverse as the other leagues do.
12. I wonder why the MLS has a lower percentage of players of color than the NFL.
13. I wonder why the MLS has a lower percentage of players of color than the WNBA.
14. I wonder why the MLS has a lower percentage of players of color than the NBA.
15. I wonder why the MLS has a higher percentage of coaches of color than the NFL does.
16. I wonder why the MLS has a higher percentage of coaches of color than the WNBA does.
17. I wonder why the MLS has a higher percentage of coaches of color than the NBA does.
18. The ratio of players of color to coaches of color in the MLS is somewhat proportionate.
19. The ratio of players of color to coaches of color in the MLS is different from the ratio in the other leagues.
20. This data does not impact me unless I want to play professionally in the WNBA.
21. I am more interested in soccer.
22. The NWSL is a women's version of the MLS.
23. The data of the NWSL is not in this data set.
24. This data probably impacts the community.
25. The community would be more concerned about the MLB.
26. The percentage of players of color in the MLB is lower than 50%.
27. The graph shows the diversity of players in different sports leagues.
28. The graph shows the diversity of coaches in different sports leagues.
29. The title of the data is "Modern Professional Sports Leagues Diversities".
